rationale: HPI clearly notes a single missed warfarin dose last week, absence of new symptoms, and daughter-assisted resumption, fulfilling all elements.
Instruct entry lists pill box and phone alerts but does not assign a specific person (only implicitly the patient) and lacks a timeframe, so partially complete.
No anticoagulation safety plan (no guidance on not doubling doses, bleeding warnings, or clinic contact) is documented.
There is no order or plan for follow-up INR within four weeks and no statement about continuing current dosing pending results.
Daughter’s involvement captured in HPI and patient’s acceptance of phone alerts implied, but not placed in Social History and limited detail, giving partial credit.
Note contains no extraneous chart data; therefore no penalty warranted.
Commands are used appropriately (separate HPI and Instruct); no misuse observed.
